pages.title: Primal Catalyst
pages.text: The $(thing)Primal Catalyst$() is an ancient machine left behind by the Architects. It cannot be crafted—only found in ancient ruins or obtained through creative mode. Its purpose: transmuting base materials into advanced alloys.$(br2)It runs on $(thing)Forge Energy$() (40 FE/tick, 100,000 FE capacity) or $(thing)Coal Blocks$() as a fallback fuel.

pages.title: Recipe: Inertial Stability Alloy
pages.text: The Catalyst has 3 input slots, 1 fuel slot, and 1 output slot. To create $(item)Inertial Stability Alloy$(), place these 3 items in any order, one per slot:$(br2)$(li)$(item)Concentrated Substrate$()$(li)$(item)Neutrion Ingot$()$(li)$(item)Graviton$()$(br2)The machine processes them automatically and produces $(item)Inertial Stability Alloy$() in the output slot.

pages.title: Power & Automation
pages.text: The Catalyst uses $(thing)FE energy$() first. If no energy is available, it burns $(item)Coal Blocks$() as fallback fuel.$(br2)$(bold)Sided automation:$()$(br)$(li)$(thing)Top$() — insert ingredients$(li)$(thing)Sides$() — insert Coal Blocks$(li)$(thing)Bottom$() — extract output$(br2)Output items are also auto-pushed to adjacent inventories every half second.$(br2)$(italic)This is the only way to create Inertial Stability Alloy.$()
